availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Lydia Hite. Father of William Hite, Rebecca Hite, John Hite, Nancy Hite, Elizabeth Hite, Joseph Hite, Harvey Hite, and Amanda Hite. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 128.
Find A Grave, "Joseph Hite (March 13, 1818-April 24, 1904)," Memorial #51175147, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/51175147 (accessed September 20, 2018).
